SNEWS  "could   allow astronomers  achance  to   make   unprecedented  observations of  the very early   turn-on of  the  supernova,"  wrote the   authors of   an   article about the new  system in the  September issue of   the "New  Journal  of  Physics." They also   noted   that   "no supernova   has  ever been   observed   soon after   its   birth."  Big  stars   end   their  lives   in  explosive  gravitational  collapses so  complete that  even  the brilliant   flashes of  light   usually announcing   these  extremely  rare  "supernova"  events   stay  trapped inside,   unseen by  astronomers,  for  the  first  hours   or   days...
